recipes.description: Delicate ravioli filled with a perfectly runny egg yolk, bathed in a nutty brown butter sage sauce. A surprisingly simple yet elegant dish.
recipes.name: Egg Yolk Ravioli with Brown Butter Sage Sauce
steps: Prepare the ravioli filling: combine ricotta, parmesan, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Roll out the pasta dough thinly.
Place a small dollop of the ricotta mixture on the dough, creating wells for the egg yolks.
Carefully place an egg yolk in each well.
Cover with another sheet of pasta dough and seal tightly, forming individual ravioli.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat until it turns brown and fragrant. Add sage leaves.
Cook the ravioli in boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes, or until they float.
Gently transfer the ravioli to the brown butter sage sauce.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra parmesan and sage.

recipes.description: A fiery and comforting twist on classic egg drop soup, featuring Korean gochujang and crunchy crispy rice for added texture.
recipes.name: Spicy Gochujang Egg Drop Soup with Crispy Rice
steps: In a pot, bring chicken broth to a simmer.
Stir in gochujang, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, and ginger.
Taste and adjust seasoning to your liking.
In a separate pan, crisp up cooked rice with a little oil until golden brown and crunchy.
Whisk eggs lightly in a bowl.
Slowly drizzle the whisked eggs into the simmering broth, stirring gently to create egg ribbons.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until the eggs are set.
Ladle the soup into bowls.
Top with crispy rice and sliced green onions.

recipes.description: A rich and flavorful frittata made with duck eggs, fresh asparagus, and earthy morel mushrooms. Perfect for a brunch or light lunch.
recipes.name: Duck Egg Frittata with Asparagus and Morel Mushrooms
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Sauté chopped shallots in olive oil until softened.
Add asparagus and morel mushrooms and cook until tender.
Whisk duck eggs with heavy cream, salt, and pepper.
Stir in the sautéed vegetables and grated Gruyere cheese.
Pour the mixture into an oven-safe skillet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the frittata is set and golden brown.
Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

recipes.description: Silky smooth and perfectly cooked egg bites prepared using the sous vide method. Topped with smoked salmon and fresh dill for a luxurious touch.
recipes.name: Sous Vide Egg Bites with Smoked Salmon and Dill
steps: Preheat water bath to 172°F (78°C).
Blend eggs, cream cheese, cottage cheese, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Pour the mixture into small jars or silicone molds.
Top each jar with chopped smoked salmon and a sprinkle of dill.
Seal the jars tightly or cover the molds with foil.
Place the jars in the preheated water bath and cook for 1 hour.
Carefully remove the jars from the water bath and let cool slightly.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with extra dill and a squeeze of lemon juice.

recipes.description: A rich and decadent Vietnamese coffee drink made with whipped egg yolks and sweetened condensed milk. A unique and unforgettable coffee experience.
recipes.name: Vietnamese Egg Coffee (Cà Phê Trứng)
steps: In a bowl, whisk egg yolks and sweetened condensed milk vigorously until light and fluffy.
Add a drop of vanilla extract if desired.
Slowly pour a small amount of hot coffee into the egg mixture while continuing to whisk, tempering the eggs.
Pour the tempered egg mixture into a glass.
Slowly pour the remaining hot coffee over the egg mixture.
If the egg mixture is too thick, add a splash of hot water to thin it out.
Serve immediately and enjoy the layers of coffee and egg cream.
